intro: Scrophularia frutescens var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf scrophularia, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a slightly hairy surface, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
